[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The OpenSG Enterprise Information Management (EIM) system defines requirements for Smart Grid interoperability.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: OpenSG EIM standardizes Smart Grid data exchange for compliance, modeling, and analytics.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: OpenSG EIM integrates with IEC CIM-compliant tools and enterprise data systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: OpenSG EIM provides web dashboards for real-time monitoring, auditing, and reporting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: OpenSG EIM supports Smart Grid devices hosting data services and analytics platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: OpenSG EIM uses TOGAF-aligned middleware for standardized integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: OpenSG EIM secures data transmission using TLS protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: OpenSG EIM is optimized for distributed and centralized models with low memory use.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: OpenSG EIM ensures real-time updates for Smart Grid data synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: OpenSG EIM is configurable for multiple deployment scales.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: OpenSG EIM connects with analytics tools and metadata platforms for data governance.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: OpenSG EIM enables data sharing, semantic modeling, and compliance auditing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: OpenSG EIM is designed for engineers, IT administrators, and regulatory teams.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: OpenSG EIM requires IEC-compliant tools and Smart Grid standards.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: OpenSG EIM assumes adherence to TOGAF-aligned architectures and IEC CIM standards.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: EIM: Enterprise Information Management for Smart Grid data governance.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: TOGAF: The Open Group Architecture Framework

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with IEC CIM-compliant data systems for Smart Grid interoperability.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide APIs for metadata exchange, validation, and governance.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable standardized data sharing for Smart Grid operations (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide semantic modeling tools to ensure data consistency (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall support data auditing, validation, and compliance monitoring.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide intuitive web dashboards with interactive reporting and guidance.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall validate and process data transactions within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall process 1 million daily transactions without degradation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store models, logs, and configurations (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to TOGAF architectural principles for Smart Grid frameworks.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall support both centralized and distributed Smart Grid deployments.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO/IEC 30141 and support NIST-compliant semantic models.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log all critical actions for auditing and provide real-time notifications for anomalies.

[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, deployment guides, and interoperability documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: TOGAF 9.2, IEC CIM documentation, and ISO/IEC 30141 standards.
